elements.title: William Anders (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Anders took the iconic photograph Earthrise (pictured)?

elements.title: Royal Oak post office shootings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an investigation into the Royal Oak post office shootings led one congressman to accuse the Postal Service of having been "asleep at the switch"?

elements.title: Gil Kim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gil Kim played professional baseball in the Netherlands, China, Australia, Spain, and Venezuela, scouted in Mexico and the Dominican Republic, and coaches in Canada?

elements.title: first Catholic synod in China (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first Catholic synod in China was held in 1803 near Chungkingchow in Sichuan Province?

elements.title: badminton in Singapore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that badminton in Singapore began in the early 19th century?

elements.title: Dove Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 17th-century freemason and alchemist Elias Ashmole attempted to invoke the spirits at the mediaeval Dove Bridge?

elements.title: Andrea Rinaldi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that former Atalanta player Andrea Rinaldi died of an aneurysm aged 19 in 2020?

elements.title: Narco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Golf Digest has described "Narco" as having "a fire beat"?
